molecule

Class VibUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • molecule.MolUtil
      • molecule.VibUtil

  • public class VibUtil
extends MolUtil
    Provides interface methods between molecule and vibration.
    Since:
    Sindo 3.0
    Version:
    1.4
    Author:
    Kiyoshi Yagi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VibUtil()
      Constructs a VibCoord object.
      VibUtil(Molecule molecule)
      Constructs a VibCoord object with a given Molecule

      • setDomain

        public void setDomain(int[][] atomIndex)
        Sets the domain for localized vibrational modes
        Parameters:
        atomIndex - index of atoms in a domain (int[Ndomain][Natom])

      • unsetDomain

        public void unsetDomain()
        Unsets the domain

      • getModeIndex

        public int getModeIndex(int nDomain,
                        int nMode)
        Returns the mode index in the system
        Parameters:
        nDomain - The index of domain
        nMode - The index of mode in the domain
        Returns:
        The index of mode in the system

      • calcNormalModes

        public CoordinateData calcNormalModes()
        Calculates and returns the normal coordinates of the given molecule. Local normal modes are created if domains are set. Returns null if hessian is not present in the electronic data.
        Returns:
        normal coordinates

      • calcNormalModes

        public CoordinateData calcNormalModes(boolean print)
        Calculates and returns the normal coordinates of the given molecule. Local normal modes are created if domains are set. Returns null if hessian is not present in the electronic data.
        Parameters:
        print - prints the results to the screen when true.
        Returns:
        normal coordinates

      • calcLocalModes

        public CoordinateData calcLocalModes(LocalCoord localco)
        Calculates the local coordinates of the given molecule with a specified setting of LocalCoord
        Parameters:
        localco - the object of LocalCoord
        Returns:
        LocalCoord (null if error)

      • calcOptimizedModes

        public CoordinateData calcOptimizedModes(java.lang.String u1dat)
        Calculates the (VSCF) optimized coordinates from the transformation matrix.
        Parameters:
        u1dat - Filename of the transformation matrix.
        Returns:
        CoordinateData of optimized coordinates (null if error).

      • calcIRintensity

        public double[] calcIRintensity()
        Calculates the infrared intensity with double harmonic approx (harmonic potential + linear dipole).
        Returns:
        return the infrared intensity of the fundamental transitions (km/mol).

      • calcRamanActivity

        public double[] calcRamanActivity()
        Calculates the Raman activity with double harmonic approx (harmonic potential + linear polarizability).
        Returns:
        return the Raman activity of the fundamental transitions (Angs^4/amu).

      • calcReducedMass

        public double[] calcReducedMass()
        Returns reduced mass of the vibrational modes
        Returns:
        double[Nfree] in emu

      • getOmega

        public double[] getOmega()
        Returns the harmonic frequency of all modes in the molecule
        Returns:
        double[Nfree] the frequency in cm-1

      • reduceVibModes

        public void reduceVibModes(int[] selectedModes)
        Reduces the number of vibrational modes in VibrationalData. The new modes are renumbered as in the sequence given in the input array.
        Parameters:
        selectedModes - an array containing the indices {0 to (Nfree-1)} of selected vibrational modes.

      • weightOfAtoms

        public double weightOfAtoms(int mode,
                            int[] atomIndex)
        Returns a weight of the vibrational mode for a given group of atoms
        Parameters:
        mode - index of the mode (0 <= mode < Nfree)
        atomIndex - index of atoms (0 <= index < Nat)
        Returns:
        weight

      • combineAllVibData

        public void combineAllVibData()
        Combine all vibrational data in current molecule. Note that, after this method is called, the original domain info is lost, and thus the domain data cannot be retrieved.

      • combineVibData

        public VibrationalData combineVibData(VibrationalData v1,
                                      VibrationalData v2)
        Combine vibrational data. The data must be domain localized modes, i.e., don't have trans/rot modes. Also, the domain of input data must not have an overlap.
        Parameters:
        v1 - Input vibrational data of domain1.
        v2 - Input vibrational data of domain2.
        Returns:
        Combined vibrational data.
